title: Running Effective 1:1s
shortDescription: Transform one-on-one meetings into valuable touchpoints that build trust and drive growth.
longDescription: Master the art of running impactful one-on-one meetings. This comprehensive guide covers preparation, conversation frameworks, and follow-up strategies to make your 1:1s the most valuable time on your calendar.

levels.title: Purpose and Preparation
levels.summary: Understand the true purpose of 1:1s and how to prepare effectively
keyPoints: 1:1s are for the direct report, not the manager
Prepare by reviewing notes and setting an agenda together
Create psychological safety through consistent scheduling
Focus on growth, development, and unblocking work

items.prompt: Who is the primary beneficiary of a 1:1 meeting?

promptI18n.zh: 誰是一對一會議的主要受益者？

options.text: The manager

textI18n.zh: 經理

options.text: The direct report

textI18n.zh: 直屬下屬

options.text: The company

textI18n.zh: 公司

options.text: Both parties equally

textI18n.zh: 雙方平等

items.explanation: While both benefit, the 1:1 is primarily for the direct report's growth, development, and support needs.

explanationI18n.zh: 雖然雙方都受益，但一對一主要是為直屬下屬的成長、發展和支持需求。

items.prompt: What is the best way to prepare for a 1:1?

promptI18n.zh: 準備一對一的最佳方法是什麼？

options.text: Show up and see what comes up

textI18n.zh: 出現並看看會發生什麼

options.text: Review previous notes and ask your report to add agenda items

textI18n.zh: 審查之前的筆記並要求您的下屬添加議程項目

options.text: Prepare a full agenda of what you want to cover

textI18n.zh: 準備一份您想要涵蓋內容的完整議程

options.text: Skip preparation to keep it casual

textI18n.zh: 跳過準備以保持隨意

items.explanation: Preparation shows respect and ensures continuity. Letting your report add agenda items ensures their priorities are addressed.

explanationI18n.zh: 準備表現出尊重並確保連續性。讓您的下屬添加議程項目可以確保他們的優先事項得到處理。

items.prompt: Describe a 1:1 meeting you've experienced that was particularly valuable. What made it effective?

promptI18n.zh: 描述一次您經歷過的特別有價值的一對一會議。是什麼讓它有效？

items.placeholder: Reflect on what made the meeting impactful...

placeholderI18n.zh: 反思是什麼讓會議有影響力...

items.guidance: Consider preparation, conversation flow, psychological safety, and outcomes from that meeting.

guidanceI18n.zh: 考慮準備、對話流程、心理安全和那次會議的結果。

items.message: Great! You understand the purpose and preparation for effective 1:1s. Let's learn how to run the conversation.

messageI18n.zh: 很好！您了解了有效一對一的目的和準備。讓我們學習如何進行對話。

items.actionHint: Ready to learn conversation techniques? Continue to the next section.

actionHintI18n.zh: 準備好學習對話技巧了嗎？繼續到下一部分。

levels.title: Running the Conversation
keyPoints: Start with personal check-in before work topics
Listen more than you speak - aim for 80/20 split
Ask open-ended questions that encourage reflection
Address blockers and development needs proactively

items.prompt: What is the recommended speaking ratio for managers in 1:1s?

promptI18n.zh: 經理在一對一會議中建議的發言比例是多少？

options.text: Manager speaks 80%, report speaks 20%

textI18n.zh: 經理發言 80%，下屬發言 20%

options.text: Manager speaks 50%, report speaks 50%

textI18n.zh: 經理發言 50%，下屬發言 50%

options.text: Manager speaks 20%, report speaks 80%

textI18n.zh: 經理發言 20%，下屬發言 80%

options.text: It doesn't matter as long as you cover everything

textI18n.zh: 只要涵蓋所有內容，這並不重要

items.explanation: The 80/20 rule (report speaks 80%, manager speaks 20%) ensures the conversation focuses on their needs and concerns.

explanationI18n.zh: 80/20 法則（下屬發言 80%，經理發言 20%）確保對話專注於他們的需求和關注點。

items.prompt: Why is starting with a personal check-in important?

promptI18n.zh: 為什麼以個人簽到開始很重要？

options.text: It's just polite conversation

textI18n.zh: 這只是禮貌的對話

options.text: It builds trust and shows you care about them as a person

textI18n.zh: 它建立信任並表明您關心他們作為一個人

options.text: It fills time if you don't have work topics

textI18n.zh: 如果您沒有工作主題，它可以填補時間

options.text: It's not important - skip to work topics

textI18n.zh: 這不重要 - 直接跳到工作主題

items.explanation: Personal check-ins build psychological safety and demonstrate that you value the whole person, not just their output.

explanationI18n.zh: 個人簽到建立心理安全，並表明您重視整個人，而不僅僅是他們的產出。

items.prompt: What are three open-ended questions you would ask in a 1:1 to encourage your direct report to reflect on their work and growth?

promptI18n.zh: 您會在一對一中問哪三個開放式問題，以鼓勵您的直屬下屬反思他們的工作和成長？

items.guidance: Think about questions that can't be answered with yes/no and that prompt deeper thinking about challenges, goals, and development.

guidanceI18n.zh: 考慮那些不能用是/否回答並能引發對挑戰、目標和發展更深入思考的問題。

items.message: Excellent! You're mastering conversation techniques. Now let's learn about follow-up and growth planning.

messageI18n.zh: 太棒了！您正在掌握對話技巧。現在讓我們學習關於後續跟進和成長規劃。

items.actionHint: Ready to learn follow-up strategies? Continue to the next section.

actionHintI18n.zh: 準備好學習後續跟進策略了嗎？繼續到下一部分。

levels.title: Follow-up and Growth Planning
levels.summary: Ensure 1:1s lead to meaningful outcomes and career growth
keyPoints: Document action items and commitments from each 1:1
Review progress on previous commitments at the start of each meeting
Use 1:1s for career development and goal setting
Provide regular feedback, not just during performance reviews

items.prompt: How should you handle action items from a 1:1?

promptI18n.zh: 您應該如何處理一對一中的行動項目？

options.text: Hope everyone remembers what they agreed to

textI18n.zh: 希望每個人都記得他們同意了什麼

options.text: Document them and review progress at the next 1:1

textI18n.zh: 記錄它們並在下一次一對一中審查進度

options.text: Only document items for the manager

textI18n.zh: 只記錄經理的項目

options.text: Skip action items to keep things casual

textI18n.zh: 跳過行動項目以保持隨意

items.explanation: Documenting and reviewing action items creates accountability and ensures progress continues between meetings.

explanationI18n.zh: 記錄和審查行動項目可以建立問責，並確保進度在會議之間持續。

items.prompt: When is the best time to give feedback in a 1:1?

promptI18n.zh: 在一對一中給予回饋的最佳時機是什麼時候？

options.text: Only during annual performance reviews

textI18n.zh: 僅在年度績效評估期間

options.text: Regularly, as part of ongoing conversation

textI18n.zh: 定期，作為持續對話的一部分

options.text: Never - feedback is for other meetings

textI18n.zh: 從不 - 回饋用於其他會議

options.text: Only when there's a serious problem

textI18n.zh: 僅當有嚴重問題時

items.explanation: Regular feedback in 1:1s prevents surprises, builds trust, and enables continuous improvement.

explanationI18n.zh: 在一對一中定期給予回饋可以防止驚喜，建立信任，並實現持續改進。

items.prompt: Describe how you would structure a 1:1 focused on career development. What topics would you cover and in what order?

promptI18n.zh: 描述您將如何構建一個專注於職業發展的一對一。您將涵蓋哪些主題以及按什麼順序？

placeholderI18n.zh: 概述您的職業發展一對一結構...

items.guidance: Consider long-term goals, skill development, opportunities, and how you can support their growth journey.

guidanceI18n.zh: 考慮長期目標、技能發展、機會，以及您如何支持他們的成長之旅。

items.message: Congratulations! You've mastered the complete approach to running effective 1:1s.

messageI18n.zh: 恭喜！您已經掌握了運行有效一對一的完整方法。

items.actionHint: Ready to transform your team's 1:1 culture?

actionHintI18n.zh: 準備好改變您團隊的一對一文化了嗎？
